akas: North Woods Law: Washington State (third season title)
akas from release info: North Woods Law: Washington State (third season title)

1.title: Cougars on the Run
1.plot: Washington's Fish and Wildlife Police search for stranded cougar cubs. In the Seattle harbor, an unsuspecting rock fish poacher is arrested. A hunter driving with a loaded weapon is caught and an officer confronts a family harvesting undersized crabs.

2.title: Stuck Young Buck
2.plot: A salmon poacher is arrested in Seattle, while in the rainforest an officer deals with an illegal elk kill. A duck hunter with a criminal past and an illegal shotgun is confronted, and a trapped black tail deer is finally freed from a storage compound.

3.title: Headless Elk
3.plot: Washington State's Fish and Wildlife Police arrest a suspect with a criminal past, investigate a headless elk and crackdown on littering. Commercial Canadian crabbers are caught illegally harvesting crabs in US waters.

4.title: Law Breaking Father and Daughter
4.plot: Washington State's Fish and Wildlife Police arrest apprehend a trespassing elk poacher and respond to a call about a sick coyote. A father and his daughter are caught in the act illegally harvesting white fish and a repeat wildlife offender is confronted.

5.title: Caught on Camera
5.plot: Officer Olson catches repeat offenders poaching more than five times the legal limit of squid. Officer Summit serves a warrant to a bear hunter breaking the law, while a fisherman is confronted for snagging salmon in closed waters.

6.title: Crabs and a Crack Pipe
6.plot: The Washington State Fish and Wildlife Police confront a lying hunter, catch a couple in the act of crab poaching and deal with anglers illegally snagging salmon. Finally, an officer must make a difficult decision regarding a blind mule deer buck.

1.title: The Thin Green LIne
1.plot: Washington's Fish & Wildlife Police are on high alert as they hunt down a fugitive. The KBD Unit deals with 3 bear cubs on the loose while covert operations uncover illegal poachers and a junkie is found with a surprising stash.

2.title: They're All Packing Rifles
2.plot: Washington's Department of Fish and Wildlife police are out to protect both citizens and animals. The force swings into action to solve an illegal elk shooting, help prevent a suicide, and stop convicted felons from hunting illegally.

3.title: Alone and Outnumbered
3.plot: Washington State's Fish and Wildlife Police bear dog unit forces a problem bear away from a family's home. An unstable woman roams the interstate, the officers nabs a fisherman with an endangered fish and catch tribal crabbers harvesting out of season.

4.title: Recipe for Disaster
4.plot: Washington State's Fish & Wildlife Police track down a suspect wanted on 3 warrants. A hunter tries to get away with killing an elk illegally, suspicious activity runs rampant in the desert, and a bear goes on a rampage inside a car.

5.title: Life or Death
5.plot: The team runs an undercover operation to stop illegal shooting in the pitch-black woods. An out of control suspect tries to evade arrest, tragedy strikes on a desert highway, and an outstanding warrant turns a family boat cruise into a nightmare.

6.title: Line of Fire
6.plot: A father goes to jail on a warrant and his son is arrested for drugs, a fisherman is caught with an illegal firearm, a wanted man is arrested and the KBD team releases an orphan bear into the wild.

1.title: Unlawfully Killed
1.plot: Washington State's Fish & Wildlife Police confront bear poachers as an inebriated suspect is taken to jail. A man with an outstanding warrant is caught having sexual relations with a woman and an officer has a surprise run in with a rattlesnake.

2.title: These Aren't Teddy Bears
2.plot: The Fish and Wildlife Police swing into action to release a menacing bear into the wild, a DUI driver is apprehended, suspects with multiple warrants are caught and taken to jail, and an officer attempts to save ducklings trapped in a storm drain.

3.title: Fugitive on the Run
3.plot: Washington Fish & Wildlife police arrest two dangerous men on felony warrants, while a fugitive at large is captured. An officer jumps to action when a car collision occurs and a trombone player serenades an officer.

4.title: Wrath of God
4.plot: In busy waters, Washington's Fish and Wildlife respond to a boating accident victim. Then the officers face a suspect with a dangerous past and arrest a man who refuses to believe in state laws. Finally, an officer helps a trapped deer and an injured owl.

5.title: Wildfire!
5.plot: Washington's Department of Fish and Wildlife police prevent the spread of a brush fire and discover marijuana grow on public land. A known sex offender is apprehended, and an officer interrupts illegally fishing activity.

6.title: Obstruction of Justice
6.plot: The WDFW police arrest an intoxicated and belligerent driver while a lying suspect with a warrant for obstructing law enforcement is apprehended. Men illegally fishing are confronted and an officer encounters a homeless man and his puppy.

7.title: Rescue on the Water
7.plot: The WDFW police race to rescue passengers on a capsized boat and arrest a suspect with multiple drug warrants. The rise of dead sturgeon on the Columbia River is investigated and a bear carcass is put to good use by a local tribe.

8.title: Threat to Kill
8.plot: The WDFW police officers ensure the safety of orca whales and a mother hen and her ducklings. A repeat offender with a dangerous past is arrested and an intoxicated driver is apprehended. After a stakeout, a black market shrimp trafficker is confronted.

9.title: Brawl on the Beach
9.plot: Washington's Department of State Fish and Wildlife police swing into action and arrest a man with multiple warrants and hunt down an assailant in a large beach brawl. Later, they confront a salmon poacher and deal with belligerent fishermen.

10.title: Tackle and Take Down
10.plot: Police release a menacing bear back into the forest and confront campers with a fire in a no burn area. On the water, a vessel is in danger of sinking and an intoxicated boater is apprehended. Finally, a sex offender tries to flee after being confronted.

imdb.plot outline: North Woods Law: Washington State follows Washington State's Department of Fish and Wildlife Law Enforcement Program as they police the Evergreen State's unforgiving mountain terrains, twisted rain forest back roads and densely populated coastal areas. In the six-episode series, viewers follow the WDFW Police Officers as they patrol more than 42 million acres of rugged terrain, half of it heavily forested and filled with wild animals, and often dangerous people. The department's dispatchers relay more 225,000 calls annually. Each day brings new challenges and extreme danger. Whether busting poachers along the USA-Canada border, going undercover to take down traffickers in the illegal animal parts trade, or tracking and capturing bears and cougars with the one-of-a-kind Karelian Bear-Dog Unit, the officers of North Woods Law: Washington State risk life and limb to protect natural resources and serve the people of Washington.
imdb.title: Rugged Justice
plot: Follows WSDFW Law Enforcement Program as they police the Evergreen State's unforgiving mountain terrains, twisted rain forest back roads and densely populated coastal areas. Each day brings new challenges and extreme danger.

North Woods Law: Washington State follows Washington State's Department of Fish and Wildlife Law Enforcement Program as they police the Evergreen State's unforgiving mountain terrains, twisted rain forest back roads and densely populated coastal areas. In the six-episode series, viewers follow the WDFW Police Officers as they patrol more than 42 million acres of rugged terrain, half of it heavily forested and filled with wild animals, and often dangerous people. The department's dispatchers relay more 225,000 calls annually. Each day brings new challenges and extreme danger. Whether busting poachers along the USA-Canada border, going undercover to take down traffickers in the illegal animal parts trade, or tracking and capturing bears and cougars with the one-of-a-kind Karelian Bear-Dog Unit, the officers of North Woods Law: Washington State risk life and limb to protect natural resources and serve the people of Washington.::Animal Planet
